did.abstract: The Jewish Peoples Philharmonic Chorus, founded in 1922 as the Freiheit Gezang Farein, was a Communist-aligned cultural organization affiliated with the Jewish People's Fraternal Order, a branch of the International Workers Order. The collection contains, sheet music, songbooks, concert programs, flyers, and a small amount of correspondence organizational records.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Jewish Peoples Philharmonic Chorus was founded in 1922 as the Freiheit Gezang Farein. The Chorus was orginially a Communist-aligned cultural organization affiliated with the Jewish People's Fraternal Order, a branch of the International Workers Order. Currently the Jewish People's Philharmonic Chorus has more than forty members and has a century-spanning repertoire including oratorios, operettas, labor anthems, folksongs, art songs, and popular tunes, all in Yiddish.
